content.body: Domenic: now I wonder what happens when you assign to a long and it's out-of-range
content.formatted_body: Domenic: now I wonder what happens when you assign to a long and it's out-of-range

content.body: annevk: The setter will never receive it, but yeah if you have `contentattribute="1111111111111111111111111"`... I suspect that does fall back to the default, but I wonder.
content.formatted_body: annevk: The setter will never receive it, but yeah if you have contentattribute="1111111111111111111111111"... I suspect that does fall back to the default, but I wonder.

content.body: Domenic: oh right, it's because all the magic is in the getters that we can't rely on Clamp and such, meh
content.formatted_body: Domenic: oh right, it's because all the magic is in the getters that we can't rely on Clamp and such, meh

content.body: Although, maybe if ConvertToInt took EnforceRange and Clamp as arguments of sorts we could actually be using that
